gunTurretB.name: Gun Turret B
gunTurretB.description: The second of the primary gun turrets.

hatchFromGunTurretB.name: Hatch to Deck B
hatchFromGunTurretB.description: A hatch leading downward to Deck B.

gunTurretC.name: Gun Turret C
gunTurretC.description: The third of the primary gun turrets.

hatchFromGunTurretC.name: Hatch to Deck B
hatchFromGunTurretC.description: A hatch leading downward to Deck B.

corridor.name: Corridor
corridor.description: A corridor allowing passage between the main hallway and upper gun bays.

gunBayB.name: Gun Bay B
gunBayB.description: A gun bay containing Gun Turret B.

gunBayC.name: Gun Bay C
gunBayC.description: A gun bay containing Gun Turret C.

gunBayD.name: Gun Bay D
gunBayD.description: A empty gun bay fit for a WMD.

ladderToDeckA.name: Ladder To Deck A
ladderToDeckA.description: A ladder leading downwards to Deck A.

sledBay.name: Sled Bay
sledBay.description: A room equipped with two sleds, each capable of boarding an enemy ship, provided that they survive the perilous journey to its hull.

engineersQuarter.name: Engineer's Quarter
engineersQuarter.description:
Piles of tools lie strewn across several large workbenches.

Several large sheets of metal stand by the door, ready to be used to patch hull and bulkhead alike.

cargoHold.name: Cargo Hold
cargoHold.description:
Various crates fill the front left quarter of the ship.

Inside them: all of the supplies needed for the arduous task that is space travel.

medBay.name: Med-Bay
medBay.description: Should any crew member sustain a serious injury, the med-bay offers a single room to house all of the various medicines and equipments used to restore them to health.

cockpit.name: Cockpit
cockpit.description:
The main command center of the ship.

All of the tools needed to pilot a modern space-faring vessel can be found here, plugged into consoles and jammed into wall spaces.

brig.name: Brig
brig.description:
An isolated prison cell.

Bars built into the walls of the ship acts as hard-points for a wide variety of restraints.

monitoring.name: Monitoring
monitoring.description: A room filled with consoles and tools fit to monitor even the most unusual of criminal scum.

livingArea.name: Living Area
livingArea.description:
The friendliest room of the ship.

Harsh metal walls give way to lighter custom paintwork and a couple of tables sit covered in equipment and the odd boardgame.

messHall.name: Mess Hall
messHall.description: Wall mounted shelves host the assorted collection of crew rations and a lone counter tops acts as the sole place clean enough to prepare food.

crewQuarters.name: Crew Quarters
crewQuarters.description:
Several beds stand near each other, each fitted like tetris pieces into one of the smallest rooms in the ship.

Only just suitable for sleep, the crew are unlikely to spend any unnecessary time within these walls.

workshop.name: Workshop
workshop.description:
A variety of machine and hand tools clutter shelves and tables.

For any craft that can't be achieved by hand, this room is the first place to look.

hallway.name: Hallway
hallway.description: A single hallway linking together almost all of the ships major rooms.

security.name: Security
security.description:
A hardened security room sits firmly in between the cockpit and the rest of the ship.

In the event of intrusion, two large doors form an impassible barrier to protect the pilot and crew.

ladderToDeckB.name: Ladder To Deck B
ladderToDeckB.description: A ladder leading upwards to Deck B.

hatchToGunTurretA.name: Hatch To Gun Turret A
hatchToGunTurretA.description: A hatch leading downwards to Gun Turret A and the main airlock.

hatchToSledA.name: Hatch To Sled A
hatchToSledA.description: A hatch leading outwards to Sled A.

hatchToSledB.name: Hatch To Sled B
hatchToSledB.description: A hatch leading outwards to Sled B.
